Replace.Text: {LOC_TECH_IRRIGATION_DESCRIPTION} Allows Farms to be built on Desert tiles. Unlocking Civil Engineeriing allows Farms to be built on Desert Hills.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food to Farms in freshwater tiles. Plantation improvements receive +1 [ICON_Food] Food.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food to Farms in non-freshwater tiles.
Upgrades Farm improvements to Modern Agriculture. +1 [ICON_Food] Food Adjacency bonus for every Farm improvement they are adjacent to.
Camp improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food.
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for embarked units. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes generate +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every 10 tiles they travel.
Quarry improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Lumber Mills may be built on Rainforests.
Grants 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title for Suleiman (Kanuni).
Quarry improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Can build Farms on Grassland Hills and Plains Hills.
Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production.。
Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production.

Upgrades Farm improvements to Mechanized Agriculture. Farm improvements now gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food from every 2 adjacent Farm improvements. Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Quarry improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Food] Food.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Lumber Mill.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production. Can only be built on Woods. Once Guilds is unlocked it can also be built on Rainforest.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Pastures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food. Can only be built on valid resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If built on Strategic resources, the city will gain use of that resource.

Awards 3 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. Allows Builders to plant Woods (second-growth). Quarry improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Woods in your territory that have never been removed (old-growth) gain +1 Appeal. Receive [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Walls. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from National Parks.
All naval and embarked units can navigate Ocean tiles.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Fishing Boats.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Fishing Boats.
+1 Production [ICON_Production] from Lumber Mills.
+1 Production [ICON_Production] from Mines. Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Reinforced Armor Plating[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against land and naval units.
+1 Production to Mines.
Allows the creation of [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to all tiles beside a river.
Allows Builders to embark. Coast, Lake, and Ocean tiles receive +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes generate +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every 5 tiles they travel.

Space Race project which launches a large rocket to land a human on the moon. Grants a one time [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus equal to 10 times your [ICON_Culture] Culture per turn, and marks the second step towards the Science Victory.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science in your [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science in every University and Consulate building.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science in every Research Lab and Chancery building.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every Temple and Consulate building.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every worship and Chancery building.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Bank, Shipyard, and Consulate building.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Stock Exchange, Seaport, and Chancery building.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Art Museum, Archeological Museum, and Consulate building.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Broadcast Center and Chancery building.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in the [ICON_Capital] Capital when producing units.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in every city with an Armory or Consulate building when producing units. Receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production if it has both these buildings.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in every city with an Armory or Consulate building when producing units. Receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production if it has both these buildings.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in the [ICON_Capital] Capital when producing wonders, buildings, and districts.

+1 [ICON_Production] Production in every city with a Factory or Consulate building when producing wonders, buildings, and districts. Receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production if it has both these buildings.

+3 [ICON_Production] Production in every city with a Chancery or Power Plant building when producing wonders, buildings, and districts. Receive +6 [ICON_Production] Production if it has both a Chancery and a Power Plant building.

+1 Faith [ICON_Faith] from tiles with Charming Appeal. Additional +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on tiles with Breathtaking Appeal. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities on tiles with Charming or Breathtaking Appeal.
Increases Healing by +30 in your City Center or Holy Site district, or any adjacent tiles.
When chosen receive a Builder in your capital. City growth rate is 25% higher.

+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from improved Strategic resources. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities with an improved [ICON_Resource_Horses] Horses or [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron resource.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards Ancient and Classical era wonders. Cities with an improved [ICON_Resource_Marble] Marble resource double these bonuses.

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Mines over Luxury and Bonus resources. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities with an improved [ICON_Resource_Copper] Copper, [ICON_Resource_Silver] Silver, or [ICON_Resource_Jade] Jade resource.

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Quarries. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities with an improved [ICON_Resource_Stone] Stone, [ICON_Resource_Gypsum] Gypsum, or [ICON_Resource_Marble] Marble resource.
+1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Points from the following districts: Holy Sites (Prophet), Campuses(Scientist), and Theater Squares (Writer).
+1 [ICON_Faith] Production and +1 [ICON_Science] Science from Geothermal Fissures and Volcanic Soil.
Shrines and Temples provide [ICON_Production] Production equal to their base [ICON_Faith] Faith output.
Cities with a specialty district receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production.

Temples provide +10% [ICON_Science] Science to their city, and an additional +15% [ICON_Science] Science if the city does not have a University. Allows Universities to be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Space Race project which speeds up your Exoplanet Expedition by +1 Light Year per turn, accelerating your progress towards a Science Victory. Can be completed up to 5 times.

+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from the Palace, Government Plaza, and Diplomatic Quarter. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every [ICON_Citizen] Population in cities with a Palace, Government Plaza, or Diplomatic Quarter.
+10% Production toward Wonders.

Land melee, ranged and anti-cavalry units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
+50% Unit Experience.
All cities with a district receive +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.
+10% Great Person points.
When you are the Suzerain of a City-State, the Capital receives a +15% boost to the Type bonuses provided by that City-State. +2 [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production per level of Walls.
+10% [ICON_Food] Food to all cities.

Shrines and Temples provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when a non-religious unit fights a civilization that follows another Religion. +4 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat.
20% Discount on Purchases with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Markets and Banks provide +2 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 Gold for every Population in all cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
+15% [ICON_Gold] Gold to all cities.
All combat units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement, and can ignore Zone of Control.
+25% Production toward Units.
+25% [ICON_Science] Science to all cities with a Factory. +100% [ICON_Production] Production towards Industrial Zone buildings.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production to all cities.
Districts provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Alliance Points with all allies increase by an additional .5 per turn.
15% Discount on Purchases with [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Cities not founded by you always have full Loyalty, and accumulating resources with improvements provide +2 per turn.
Commercial Hubs and Encampments provide cities with +10% [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in all cities, and +3 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism per Specialty District.
+25% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
+6 [ICON_Power] Power in all cities. Speeds up your Exoplanet Expedition ship by 3 Light Years per turn.
Campuses and Industrial Zones provide cities with +15% [ICON_Science] Science.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from Fascism
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from Fascism.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement from Fascism.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Not affected by enemy zone of control (Fascism).
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity in all cities with at least 3 specialty districts.
+2 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each Research Lab, Military Academy, Coal Power Plant, Oil Power Plant, and Nuclear Power Plant.
Established [ICON_GOVERNOR] Governors with at least 2 Promotions provide +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
Military Academies, Seaports, and Renaissance Walls generate +4 [ICON_Science] Science.
+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to all cities with at least 2 specialty districts.

{1_name} ({2_type})[NEWLINE]Created by {3_author}[NEWLINE]Created in {4_date}[NEWLINE]Provides 3 [ICON_Culture] Culture 3 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism per turn when authored by an artist who already has art displayed here.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. +50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
Allows the purchase of civilian units with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Reveals [ICON_RESOURCE_ANTIQUITY_SITE] Antiquity Sites. Allows construction of Archaeologists.
+100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art and [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Music.
+50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Seaside Resorts.
Allows the building of National Parks and the purchase of Naturalists with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Awards 2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.

Reveals [ICON_RESOURCE_SHIPWRECK] Shipwrecks, and allows Archaeologists to extract [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts from them. Awards 3 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts.
Offshore Wind Farms, Solar Farms, Wind Farms, and Geothermal Power Plants provide [ICON_Tourism] Tourism equal to its [ICON_Power] Power.

+200% [ICON_POWER] Power for all Offshore Windfarms, Solar Farms, Wind Farms, Geothermal Plants, and Hydroelectric Dams. +1 Appeal to tiles adjacent to Rainforest and Marsh in your empire. Must be built along a River adjacent to a Neighborhood district.
+100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism to all wonders.

A National Park's [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism output is equal to the total Appeal of all the tiles included in the park. Additionally, the city that owns the park receives 2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, and the four closest cities in your civilization receive 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Seaside Resorts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Tourism] Tourism and [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to the tile's Appeal. Can only be built on Coastal Desert, Coastal Plains, or Coastal Grassland tiles. Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Geothermal Plant.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science. +4 [ICON_Production] Production. Provides 4 [ICON_Power] Power per turn. Must be built on a Geothermal Fissure.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Solar Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. +3 [ICON_Production] Production. Provides 2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn. Must be built on flat terrain. Cannot be built on Snow.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Wind Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. +3 [ICON_Production] Production. Provides 2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn. Must be built on Hills terrain.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct an Offshore Wind Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Production] Production. Provides 2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn. Must be built on Coast or Lake terrain.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Seastead.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Production] Production, and +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each adjacent Fishing Boats. Fishing Boats receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each adjacent Seastead. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for every adjacent Reef. +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing. Must be built on Coast, Lake or Ocean terrain. Cannot be placed adjacent to another Seastead.

Monumentality Golden Age:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all Builders. May purchase civilian units with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Builders and Settlers are 20% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_FAITH] Faith and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from world wonders.

+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity, +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing, and +25% Growth in Cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors[NEWLINE]-2 Loyalty in Cities without [ICON_Governor] Governors.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
生产开拓者时 [ICON_Production] 生产力+25%。[NEWLINE]获得1个免费的开拓者和1个免费的建造者。[NEWLINE]奖励1个 [Icon_Governor] 总督头衔。
25% increased [ICON_Production] Production toward Settlers in this city.[NEWLINE]Receive a free Settler and Builder.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
A district in your city for cultural sites.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture when built on Charming tiles, +3 Culture when built on Breathtaking tiles.

A district unique to Greece for cultural sites. Replaces the Theater Square district and cheaper to build. Awards 1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy when completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture when built on Charming tiles, +3 Culture when built on Breathtaking tiles. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent district and an additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for adjacent City Center. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent wonder, Entertainment Complex, and Water Park. Can only be built on Hills.

+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +2 [ICON_Food] Food to all Marsh tiles in your empire. +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Floodplains tiles for this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Floodplains or Marsh.
Increases growth by 25% in all cities. Must be built next to a River.

Patronage of Great People costs 25% less [ICON_Faith] Faith. [ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide an extra 10% of the Science and Culture cost for researching technologies and civics. Districts in this city provide +2 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points of their type (for example, [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer points from the Theater Square district). Must be built on Hills.

Mountain tiles provide a standard adjacency bonus to Theater Square and Industrial Zone districts, and a major adjacency bonus to Commercial Hub districts in all cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on a Mountain tile that does not contain a Volcano.
Receive +2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +1 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy when you build a wonder, including Apadana, in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants a Trader unit. +1 [ICON_Gold] to Coast, Lake, and Ocean tiles. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.

Receive [ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas to all Ancient and Classical era technologies. Receive a random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka after another player recruits a [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Campus district with a Library.
Naval units receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on the Coast, and adjacent to land and a Harbor district with a Lighthouse.

+2 Diplomatic Victory Points and grants 3 Apostles when built. Religious pressure to adjacent cities is 100% stronger from this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Woods adjacent to a Holy Site district with a Temple, and you must have founded a Religion.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on all Desert tiles for this city (non-Floodplains). +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants a Trader unit. Must be built on Desert or Desert Floodplains without Hills.

Grants 3 Crossbowmen and 3 Swordsmen. All current units gain a promotion level. All Archaeologists from the owner may enter foreign lands without Open Borders. Must be built on flat Grassland or Plains adjacent to an Encampment district with a Barracks or Stable.

+20% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city. Grants 4 Warrior Monks. These Warrior Monks start with a free promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to a Holy Site district with a Temple. Warrior Monks can only be received if player has founded a religion or if there is a majority religion for this player or city.
Kotoku-In
Starts with a free promotion.

+2 [ICON_Science] Science from Shrines and Temples. Other Civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to this city provide +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for them. +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on the Desert or Desert Hills, and adjacent to a Campus district with a University.
+1 Military policy slot[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+20% [ICON_Culture] to this city. Provides the same defensive bonuses as the Fort improvement. Must be built on Hills adjacent to an Encampment district.

+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Food] Food to all Rainforest tiles for this city. +1 [ICON_Production] Production to all Rainforest tiles for this city. Must be built on Rainforest.
Missionaries and Apostles can spread Religion 2 extra times. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Holy Site district, and you must have founded a Religion.

+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity from entertainment for each Lake tile within one tile of Huey Teocalli. +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Lake tile in your empire. Must be built on a Lake tile adjacent to land.

+100% [ICON_Tourism] Religious Tourism from this city. +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on all Tundra tiles for this city. Must be built adjacent to a City Center.

+1 Era Score from Historic Moment earned after this wonder is complete if that Moment is usually worth 2 or more Era Score. +15% to all non-Food yields in all cities when in a Golden Age. Must be built next to a River.
+1 Wildcard policy slot[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 Diplomatic Victory points. Must be built on flat land adjacent to the City Center.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants a Trader unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city get +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every Bonus resource within 3 tiles of the city and in this city's territory. Must be built adjacent to a Commercial Hub district with a Market and adjacent to [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle.

International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city receive +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Luxury Resource at the destination. When the Torre de Belém is constructed, cities not on your home continent receive the lowest [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production cost city center building they can currently construct, as well as a free Builder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on a Coast tile that is adjacent to a Harbor district.
Receive a second naval unit each time you train a naval unit. Grants a free [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer. Must be built on a Coast tile that is adjacent to an Industrial Zone district.

+4 Diplomatic Victory Points when built. Grants 3 Builders. +0.5 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in this city. All your cities within 6 tiles are always 100% Loyal. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.

+100% [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn from starting a turn as Suzerain of a City-State. +2 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Gold] Gold from each city-state you are Suzerain of.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on a River.
+50% [ICON_Culture] Culture to this city. Must be built along a River.

+2 [ICON_Production] Production from Workshops and Factories. +20% [ICON_Production] Production in this city, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each Mine and Quarry in this city. Must be built along a River adjacent to an Industrial Zone district with a Factory.
Grants a free [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Theater Square district.

2 free random Atomic era [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations. [ICON_Tourism] Tourism output from [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics and Holy Cities is not diminished by other civilizations who have researched The Enlightenment civic. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Seaside Resorts across your civilization. Must be built on Hills.

Grants a free [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist. +20% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all cities. If there are 5 Snow or Snow Hills tiles within 3 tiles of a city and owned by this player these yields are doubled. Must be built next to a Campus with a Research Lab on a Snow or Snow Hills tile.

+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in each city in your civilization. +10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism to Entertainment Complexes and Water Parks. Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Entertainment Complex district with a Stadium.
Receive [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations to all Atomic and Information civics. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.
